transcripts.text: Ladies and gentlemen, my name is Justin Prep.  This is an epic, awesome, amazing episode of the Boxing Authority Liberty BitChute YouTube channel. That's just... what I've known from the past. I mean, that's insane.  That's like your car engine, right? So you go down this list and the most important setting is gonna be your Precision Boost Overdrive.  Now some people just completely turn this off in order to solve their problems.  But precision boost overdrive can actually help.  And what precision boost overdrive does that is helpful is when your computer is doing a single core process, it will go ahead and allow the CPU to run faster, hotter on that one process.  And as long as you keep this on, that is still going to happen.  So that means that even though you set a thermal level of 54 degrees Celsius, which is about 130 degrees Fahrenheit, you still might see it spike once in a while, and I mean spike, right?  It's not going to stay there, hopefully.  It's going to spike up to 151 degrees or 54 Fahrenheit in there.  And that's not the end of the world.  It does it just for a second. But in any case, we have a platform thermal throttle limit, and we change that to manual here instead of auto.  And then I just set mine at 54 degrees Celsius, which is 130 degrees Fahrenheit.  And by doing that, it has helped my CPU most of the time stay at or below 130 degrees Fahrenheit with slight spikes once in a while up to 131 degrees Fahrenheit when it's doing multi-core processes and that sort of thing.
